## Protected Member Functions

### AddPseudoTwoAddrDeps() {#a883ff468e6ea584087e66416d02a5e48}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void RegReductionPQBase::AddPseudoTwoAddrDeps ()"
  labels = {["protected"]}>
AddPseudoTwoAddrDeps - If two nodes share an operand and one of them uses it as a def&amp;use operand.

Add a pseudo control edge from it to the other node (if it won&#39;t create a cycle) so the two-address one will be scheduled first (lower in the schedule). If both nodes are two-address, favor the one that has a CopyToReg use (more likely to be a loop induction update). If both are two-address, but one is commutable while the other is not commutable, favor the one that&#39;s not commutable.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/selectiondag/scheduledagrrlist-cpp/#l01841">1841</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/selectiondag/scheduledagrrlist-cpp">ScheduleDAGRRList.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### PrescheduleNodesWithMultipleUses() {#a6df9e18cc58cb146ccfa7c7d47b6b9ca}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void RegReductionPQBase::PrescheduleNodesWithMultipleUses ()"
  labels = {["protected"]}>
PrescheduleNodesWithMultipleUses - Nodes with multiple uses are not handled well by the general register pressure reduction heuristics.

When presented with code like this: 

<CodeBlock>
 N
</CodeBlock> / | / | U store | ...

the heuristics tend to push the store up, but since the operand of the store has another use (U), this would increase the length of that other use (the U-&gt;N edge).

This function transforms code like the above to route U&#39;s dependence through the store when possible, like this: 

<CodeBlock>
 N
 ||
 ||
store
  |
  U
  |
 ...
</CodeBlock>

This results in the store being scheduled immediately after N, which shortens the U-&gt;N live range, reducing register pressure.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/selectiondag/scheduledagrrlist-cpp/#l01842">1842</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/selectiondag/scheduledagrrlist-cpp">ScheduleDAGRRList.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
